tuc.ece.cs202.project2

Class StaticBST

  • java.lang.Object
    • tuc.ece.cs202.project2.StaticBST

  • public class StaticBST
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for the Static Binary Search Tree

    All the information is saved in a Nx3 array (with N=the number of nodes)

    It contains methods for:

    1. Node Insertion

    2. Key Search in the tree

    3. Key Search of a range in the tree

    4. Printing all the nodes using Inorder Traversal

    Author:
    Georgios Frangias

        public void insertKey(int key,

        Method to insert a new node in the tree

        key - the key of the node that will be inserted

        public void searchKey(int index,

        A method to display if the key in search was found by keyQuery

      • keyQuery

        public boolean keyQuery(int index,
                        int key)
        A method that traverses the tree in search of a key
        Parameters:
        key - the key in search
        index - the index of the node that the method is currently using during tree traversal
        Returns:
        a boolean variable that is:

        true if the key was found in the tree and

        false if it wasn't found

      • inorderPrint

        public void inorderPrint(int index)
        A method that prints the tree's keys in order using inorder traversal
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the node that the method is currently using during tree traversal

      • rangeQuery

        public void rangeQuery(int index,
                       int k1,
                       int k2)
        A method that prints all the nodes that have keys in range [ki,k2]
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the node that the method is currently using during tree traversal
        k1 - the lower end of the range in search
        k2 - the upper end of the range in search
